intro: Paronychia cephalotes var. recurvans, commonly known as the curled leaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are often curled or rolled. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is occasionally cultivated in rock gardens and xeriscapes.
